messages.message: unfortunately it is not possible to reuse the same cleaning function yet - we have a long-existing EPD ticket (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1276) tracking this feature request

this kind of logic may be more reliable via a cleaning custom function?

i hear you that this is a common operation that would be easy to solve via a quick clean option

cc @Kaustubh (KD)

The first issue you are facing the the prompt not actually functioning as expected is interesting. @SÅ‚awek Biel / @Nikolaos Kofinas do you folks have thoughts here? This is definitely something our customers should not experience if we can help it.

The second issue as @Serena mentioned is on our backlog, we haven't heard too much noise around it but we can consider this if we get more feedback (candidly its not prioritized for Q4 yet)

Got it. Thanks both!

Besides the UX issues, how does the non-reusability of cleaning functions affect performance? If I copy-paste the same cleaning code across 100+ different fields from 5+ different classes, then I can imagine all those extra "unique" functions could add up to making the project files unnecessarily large and clunky. I've seen mention of things like validation functions freezing and crashing the front end UI, so this feels like a plausible threat.

I think having this be part of a prompt is problematic, this is only one usecase but I can imagine more (e.g. date format in specific format, time in specific format, address in specific format) and this will drag down the performance of the model (and we will not be able to capture all of them).

In my opinion, we should have predefined functions (As you described) that the use can quickly pick and choose from
